title: Golf Game: Shaping the Core Idea
summary: Early brainstorming of a new low-poly multiplayer golf game inspired by Big Walk & peak's visuals.
html:
Idea

I thought for a while about what I wanted to do for a multiplayer game. Something that my creativity could go crazy.

Approach

Had inspiration from games like Big Walk and Peak on stylized visuals, gameplay, and silly animations.

Notes

  • Scope is set for 2-4 players.
  • Prototype visuals to guide tone.

title: Golf Game: First Character Build
summary: Modeled the first playable character: a duck that I am currently calling Don, a golfer, to fit the low-poly aesthetic.
html:
Overview

The first character established the style guide for proportions, animations, and color palette.

Process

Blocked in Blender, kept face geometry minimal for later eye animations, textured with flat colors. I used ChatGPT to create character concepts so I can have a good idea of the characters and world that I want to create.

Future

Next I hope to create the other characters that I want to implement and do some of the animations for them.

title: Golf Game: First Steps in Unreal
summary: Setup Unreal project, basic golf course level, and tested initial networking for multiplayer. Image source GameSpot
html:
Setup

Created project in Unreal 5, integrated starter assets. Image source Ravalmatic

Challenges

First time diving into Unreal, so it is being a challenge to learn a new software.

Next Steps

  • Implement controls.
  • Implement multiplayer.
